snippet: Omri Shefet, who is known at East Side Middle School for his vast knowledge of sports, was one of only five students from the school to not be chosen in the high school lottery.
abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column on the travails of learning-disabled student Omri Shefet, one of only five eighth-graders at Manhattan's East Side Middle School who were not picked by any high school in the first round of of the city's student selection lottery; Omri has received an outpouring of support from faculty and students and has high hopes for the second round of high school acceptances.
lead_paragraph: Omri Shefet, who is known at East Side Middle School for his vast knowledge of sports, was one of only five students from the school to not be chosen in the high school lottery.

headline.seo: Eighth Grader Full of Sports Knowledge Is Left Without a High School
headline.main: An Eighth-Grade Sports Encyclopedia Finds Himself Without a High School
headline.print_headline: An Eighth-Grade Sports Encyclopedia Finds Himself Without a High School
